text: [Music]
hey everybody its Anna with my tips and
advice for English learners in the
English fluency journey and today I'm
gonna spill the beans on my practice
routine I've been getting this question
so many times lately so that's what I'm
gonna share with you and the idiom spill
the beans means to give away secrets
secret information but actually that's
not a secret at all so first I'm gonna
describe my day this is what I do every
single day except for days when I'm not
feeling so good or maybe I'm sick or god
forbid my son sick or if those days
already planned out so I get up at 7
a.m. usually sometimes it's 6 a.m. and
the first thing that I do is my speaking
exercises so I drill some sounds words
then I watch some news videos read
articles books all that in English a
forest work on my grandma and I do all
these things till my son wakes up then
throughout the day I watched something
read something in English to learn some
words when I have time because they have
a lot of things to do besides that you
know like regular people stop when I
take walks with my son and listen to
some podcasts and in the evenings I
usually practice as well by practicing I
mean I drill some words or sounds that
are difficult for me so this is
approximately my daily studying routine
it varies and depends of course now I'm
going to show you my notebooks I have
three of them so far and I write down
here all the words idioms expressions
that are useful interesting for me and
the ones that I'm actually going to use
and I go back to them every once in a
while to repeat because repetition
repetition repetition this is how we
learn and also I write down here all the
words collocations expressions that I
want to in need to work on so that not
to forget them and drill them later and
also when I want you to be show or a
movie or something else in English I
always try to have a notebook nearby so
I read down here all the words
expressions idioms etc so that
can search for their meanings later
because I don't want to pause a movie
every single time when I want to look up
some word and if I don't have a notebook
nearby that I always have my phone with
me so I just record those words to the
voice memos but I don't do it all the
time just whenever I feel like doing it
and also I can pick some youtube video
and work on it and as usual I write down
on your worth sirs there meetings and
work and some pronunciation points and I
work in that video for a few days
maybe even for a week it depends on the
video so for me it's quality over
quantity
next I have these stickers and they are
everywhere around my apartment and here
I read down all the names of the things
that surround me or something else that
I'm trying to start using so this is
another way how I expand my vocabulary
because I get to see them and read them
all the time and I think that this is
really useful to know the names of
things that we see every single day and
you can even talk to yourself about
something that you're doing or think to
yourself for example you're doing
laundry so you can describe your actions
okay so now I'm loading the clothes into
the washing machine and let's put in a
bit of laundry detergent and now I have
to turn this dial to pick a wash cycle
and let's press the start button oh
that's an example you've got the idea
and also I need the names of these
things because they talked to my son in
English let's say 90% of the time
because I'm raising a bilingual child
and I need to explain a lot of things to
him using a proper language and also I
talked to my husband in English let's
say 70% of the time whenever I have a
doubt about prepositions were scull
occasions whatever that I want to use I
try to check them right away if I can so
I google them I search for information
but I don't randomly reaches some
grammar rules or some lists of phrasal
verbs it doesn't work for me it has to
be something that I'm gonna you
that I need to use it has to be
irrelevant because this is the best way
for me to truly remember something and I
try to learn naturally and to immerse
myself in the language as much as
possible so this is basically what I do
on my own to learn you don't have to do
all this if it sounds overwhelming to
you I'm just sharing but you can try
something or you can find something that
works for you but remember to do at
least something to give some effort to
that and when I started I started slow
so I practice just a couple of times a
week and I've been learning just a few
words in two weeks for example start
with baby steps don't overwhelm yourself
much because in this case you may lose
this desire to learn and you're probably
wondering where to find all these
exercises to practice and drill sounds
well guys we have all this information
